item.title: 萤火虫公司获美国联邦航空局批准恢复阿尔法火箭发射
item.description: 萤火虫宇航公司（Firefly Aerospace）周二表示，该公司已获得美国联邦航空管理局的许可，可以恢复阿尔法火箭的发射。【原文：Firefly Aerospace on Tuesday said it has received clearance from the Federal Aviation Administration to resume Alpha rocket launches, after a technical issue led to a failure in April.】

item.title: 网络安全工具需求激增，Okta上调年度预期
item.description: 网络安全公司Okta周二上调了年度营收和利润预期，押注随着企业加强对人工智能攻击的防御，对其身份验证工具的需求将不断增长。【原文：Cybersecurity company Okta raised annual revenue and profit forecasts on Tuesday, betting on growing demand for its identity verification tools as enterprises strengthen defenses against artificial intelligence-powered attacks.】

item.title: 特朗普瓦解美国风能和太阳能产业的时间表
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）利用他在白宫的第二个任期阻止了风能和太阳能设施的发展，而这些设施是前总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）气候和能源议程的基石。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump has used his second term in the White House to stymie development of wind and solar energy facilities that were a cornerstone of former President Joe Biden's climate and energy agendas.】

item.title: 8 月中旬，纳斯达克指数的空头兴趣较 7 月下旬上升了 2.02
item.description: 纳斯达克交易所周二表示，8 月中旬纳斯达克股票市场的空头利率上升了 2.02%。【原文：Short interest on the Nasdaq rose 2.02% in mid-August, the exchange said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 交易日 利率前景胜过美联储动荡加深
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 美联储理事库克的抵押贷款：已知与未知
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他将以 "原因 "为由解除美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）的职务，理由是他认为库克在 2021 年办理的两笔抵押贷款中存在 "虚假陈述"，而这距离参议院批准她担任美联储理事的任命还有大约一年时间。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump says he is removing Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook for "cause," citing what he said were "false statements" on two mortgages she took out in 2021, about a year before the Senate confirmed her appointment to the Fed.】

item.title: 法官缩小了针对伯克希尔旗下 PacifiCorp 公司的美国野火诉讼范围
item.description: 美国政府对伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）旗下 PacifiCorp 公用事业部门提起诉讼，要求赔偿 2020 年俄勒冈州野火造成的 9 亿多美元损失。【原文：A federal judge on Tuesday dismissed a negligence claim in the U.S. government's lawsuit against Berkshire Hathaway's PacifiCorp utility unit, which seeks more than $900 million in damages stemming from a 2020 wildfire in Oregon.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，美国司法部正在调查 UnitedHealth 的处方管理服务
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道，美国司法部刑事司正在调查联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）旗下药房福利管理公司的商业行为。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department's criminal division is digging into business practices at UnitedHealth Group's pharmacy benefit manager, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 联邦通信委员会主席卡尔为派拉蒙全球公司与天舞公司的合并批准进行辩护
item.description: 联邦通信委员会主席布兰登-卡尔（Brendan Carr）为该机构批准 Skydance Media 收购 Paramount Global 的审查进行辩护，认为这是例行公事，符合公众利益。【原文：Federal Communications Commission Chairman Brendan Carr defended the agency's review approving Skydance Media's acquisition of Paramount Global as routine and in the public interest.】

item.title: 加拿大太平洋铁路公司与巴菲特一道拒绝铁路合并，缩小合并前景
item.description: 两家主要铁路运营商已经退出了过去一个月笼罩整个行业的兼并游戏，重塑了竞争格局，并提高了联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific）拟以 850 亿美元与诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern）合并的监管风险。【原文：Two major rail operators have taken themselves out of the merger game that has gripped the industry for the past month, reshaping the competitive landscape and raising the regulatory stakes for Union Pacific's proposed $85 billion tie-up with Norfolk Southern .】

item.title: 特朗普称 Meta 计划在路易斯安那州建立的人工智能数据中心将耗资 500 亿美元
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周二在内阁会议上表示，Meta 公司计划在路易斯安那州建立的人工智能数据中心将耗资 500 亿美元。【原文：Meta's planned AI data center in Louisiana will cost $50 billion, President Donald Trump said during a cabinet meeting on Tuesday.】

item.title: 肯尼迪称，特朗普机构联手审查海上风电
item.description: 美国卫生与公众服务部部长小罗伯特-肯尼迪（Robert F. Kennedy Jr.【原文：A group of U.S. federal agencies, including the departments of defense, energy and commerce, are working together to review offshore wind farms approved by the Biden administration along the Atlantic coast, U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美联储声明：库克将寻求司法裁决继续留任
item.description: 美联储在周二的一份声明中表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普因指控美联储理事丽莎-库克在抵押贷款中存在虚假陈述而要求解除她的职务，美联储将寻求法院批准她继续在美国中央银行任职。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, whose removal is being sought by President Donald Trump over allegations of misstatements on her mortgages, will seek court approval for her continued ability to serve in her role at the U.S. central bank, the Fed said in a statement Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局资助防止飞机失控事故的系统
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）周二宣布，费城国际机场的一条跑道因安装了阻止飞机失控的系统而重新开放。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration on Tuesday touted the reopening of a runway at Philadelphia International Airport through the installation of a system to stop a runaway airplane.】

item.title: 美国批准向波兰出售价值 18.5 亿美元的 F-35 维护设备
item.description: 五角大楼周二表示，美国国务院已批准可能向波兰出售F-35喷气式战斗机的维持及相关后勤和项目支持要素，估计费用为18.5亿美元。【原文：The U.S. State Department has approved the potential sale of sustainment and related elements of logistics and program support for F-35 jets to Poland for an estimated cost of $1.85 billion, the Pentagon said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国再取消 1.75 亿美元加州高铁项目
item.description: 美国交通部周二表示，将取消为加州高铁项目中的四个项目提供的 1.75 亿美元拨款，这是继今年 7 月取消为加州雄心勃勃但却拖延已久的高铁项目提供的 40 亿美元联邦拨款之后的又一举措。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said on Tuesday it is cancelling $175 million for four projects that are part of California's high-speed rail project, following cancellation of $4 billion in federal grants for the state's ambitious but much-delayed high-speed rail project in July.】

item.title: 阿根廷央行在腐败指控后提高银行准备金要求
item.description: 阿根廷央行周二将银行存款准备金率上调至分析师认为可能导致经济放缓的水平，分析师称此举旨在安抚市场，因为哈维尔-米莱伊总统的政府在关键的立法选举前受到腐败指控的冲击。【原文：Argentina's central bank on Tuesday raised its reserve requirements for banks to a level analysts said could risk slowing the economy, a move analysts say aims to soothe markets as the government of President Javier Milei is rocked by corruption allegations ahead of key legislative elections.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，克罗格公司将裁员近千人
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引临时首席执行官罗恩-萨金特（Ron Sargent）发给员工的一份备忘录报道，克罗格公司将裁员近 1000 人。【原文：Kroger is laying off nearly 1000 corporate workers, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing a memo sent to staff by interim CEO Ron Sargent.】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会唯一的民主党委员确定离职日期
item.description: 美国商品期货交易委员会（Commodity Futures Trading Commission）中唯一的民主党人、该机构仅剩的两名委员之一周二表示，她将于 9 月 3 日离开监管机构。【原文：The lone Democrat on the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission, and one of just two remaining commissioners at the agency, said on Tuesday that she will leave the regulator on September 3.】

item.title: 美国商务部确认对 10 个国家征收反倾销税
item.description: 美国商务部在对耐腐蚀钢产品进行调查后，于周二发布了针对 10 个国家的反倾销和反补贴税的肯定性裁定。【原文：The U.S. Department of Commerce on Tuesday issued affirmative determinations of anti-dumping and countervailing duties against 10 countries after investigations into corrosion-resistant steel products.】

item.title: 贝森特称美国关税收入每年可能远超 5000 亿美元
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周二表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税带来的关税收入每年可能高达 5000 亿美元，其中 7 月至 8 月大幅飙升，9 月的飙升幅度可能更大。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Tuesday that customs duty revenues from President Donald Trump's tariffs may top $500 billion a year, with a substantial jump from July to August and likely a bigger jump in September.】

item.title: 特朗普撤换美联储理事的努力将考验国债市场
item.description: 由于担心过于鸽派的美国央行可能会失去对通胀的控制，美国债券投资者预计唐纳德-特朗普总统对美联储施加控制的最新尝试将推低美国长期债券的价值。【原文：U.S. bond investors expect President Donald Trump's latest attempt to exert control over the Federal Reserve to push down the value of long-dated U.S. debt on concerns that an overly dovish U.S. central bank may lose its grip on inflation.】

item.title: 加拿大央行行长称明年不会重新考虑 2% 的通胀目标
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee【原文：By Promit Mukherjee】

item.title: 部长表示，加拿大和盟国将探索为关键矿产项目提供资金
item.description: 加拿大能源与自然资源部长蒂姆-霍奇森（Tim Hodgson）周二告诉路透社记者，加拿大正在与盟国合作，为关键矿产交易提供潜在资金，类似于美国政府与MP材料公司合作，使来自中国的供应链多样化。【原文：Canada is working with its allies to potentially fund critical mineral transactions, similar to what the U.S. government did with MP Materials to diversify the supply chain from China, Energy and Natural Resources Minister Tim Hodgson told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 边疆航空公司关注美国主要市场的增长
item.description: 边疆航空公司（Frontier Airlines）首席执行官巴里-比弗尔（Barry Biffle）周二表示，由于竞争对手精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）的财务问题和西南航空公司（Southwest Airlines）决定终止允许免费托运行李的政策，这家廉价航空公司看到了扩大市场份额的机会。【原文：Frontier Airlines CEO Barry Biffle said on Tuesday the budget carrier is seeing an opportunity to grow its market share, thanks to financial troubles at rival Spirit Airlines and Southwest Airlines' decision to end its policy of allowing free checked bags.】

item.title: OpenAI和Altman因ChatGPT在加州青少年自杀事件中的作用而被起诉
item.description: 一名青少年在 ChatGPT 指导下学习自残方法后自杀身亡，其父母周二起诉 OpenAI 和首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman），称该公司在去年推出 GPT-4o 版人工智能聊天机器人时，故意将利润置于安全之上。【原文：The parents of a teen who died by suicide after ChatGPT coached him on methods of self harm sued OpenAI and CEO Sam Altman on Tuesday, saying the company knowingly put profit above safety when it launched the GPT-4o version of its artificial intelligence chatbot last year.】

item.title: 美国法院裁定，"F "字商标申请失败应重新审查
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院周二命令美国专利商标局重新考虑其拒绝涉及淫秽词汇 "fuck "的商标申请的决定。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday ordered the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office to reconsider its decision to deny an application for a trademark covering the obscenity word "fuck."】

item.title: Anthropic 就美国作家提出的侵犯版权集体诉讼达成和解
item.description: 人工智能公司 Anthropic 周二在一份法庭文件中表示，该公司已与一群美国作家的集体诉讼达成和解，这些作家认为该公司的人工智能训练侵犯了他们的版权。【原文：Artificial intelligence company Anthropic said in a court filing on Tuesday it had settled a class action lawsuit from a group of U.S. authors who argued the company's AI training infringed their copyrights.】

item.title: 据 Politico 报道，Meta 将启动加州超级政治行动委员会，支持支持人工智能的候选人
item.description: 据 Politico 周二报道，Meta 正在成立一个新的以加利福尼亚州为重点的政治行动委员会（PAC），以支持州一级支持放宽对技术，尤其是人工智能监管的候选人。【原文：Meta is setting up a new California-focused political action committee (PAC) to back state-level candidates favoring lighter regulation of technology, particularly artificial intelligence, Politico reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 机构称，Stellantis 今年支付了 1.906 亿美元的美国燃油经济性罚款
item.description: 据一份政府报告和这家意大利-美国汽车制造商称，克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特今年因未达到美国燃油经济性要求而支付了 1.906 亿美元的罚款。【原文：Chrysler-parent Stellantis paid $190.6 million in penalties this year for not meeting U.S. fuel economy requirements, according to a government report and the Italian-U.S. automaker.】
